articles.title: Inside OpenAI’s in-house data agent
articles.summary: How OpenAI built an in-house AI data agent that uses GPT-5, Codex, and memory to reason over massive datasets and deliver reliable insights in minutes.

articles.title: Taisei Corporation shapes the next generation of talent with ChatGPT
articles.summary: Taisei Corporation uses ChatGPT Enterprise to support HR-led talent development and scale generative AI across its global construction business.

articles.title: Retiring GPT-4o, GPT-4.1, GPT-4.1 mini, and OpenAI o4-mini in ChatGPT
articles.summary: On February 13, 2026, alongside the previously announced retirement⁠ of GPT‑5 (Instant, Thinking, and Pro), we will retire GPT‑4o, GPT‑4.1, GPT‑4.1 mini, and OpenAI o4-mini from ChatGPT. In the API, there are no changes at this time.

articles.title: The next chapter for AI in the EU
articles.summary: OpenAI launches the EU Economic Blueprint 2.0 with new data, partnerships, and initiatives to accelerate AI adoption, skills, and growth across Europe.

articles.title: EMEA Youth & Wellbeing Grant
articles.summary: Apply for the EMEA Youth & Wellbeing Grant, a €500,000 program funding NGOs and researchers advancing youth safety and wellbeing in the age of AI.

articles.title: Keeping your data safe when an AI agent clicks a link
articles.summary: Learn how OpenAI protects user data when AI agents open links, preventing URL-based data exfiltration and prompt injection with built-in safeguards.

articles.title: PVH reimagines the future of fashion with OpenAI
articles.summary: PVH Corp., parent company of Calvin Klein and Tommy Hilfiger, is adopting ChatGPT Enterprise to bring AI into fashion design, supply chain, and consumer engagement.

articles.title: Introducing Prism
articles.summary: Prism is a free LaTeX-native workspace with GPT-5.2 built in, helping researchers write, collaborate, and reason in one place.

articles.title: Powering tax donations with AI powered personalized recommendations
articles.summary: TRUSTBANK partnered with Recursive to build Choice AI using OpenAI models, delivering personalized, conversational recommendations that simplify Furusato Nozei gift discovery. A multi-agent system helps donors navigate thousands of options and find gifts that match their preferences.

articles.title: How Indeed uses AI to help evolve the job search
articles.summary: Indeed’s CRO Maggie Hulce shares how AI is transforming job search, recruiting, and talent acquisition for employers and job seekers.

articles.title: Unrolling the Codex agent loop
articles.summary: A technical deep dive into the Codex agent loop, explaining how Codex CLI orchestrates models, tools, prompts, and performance using the Responses API.

articles.title: Scaling PostgreSQL to power 800 million ChatGPT users
articles.summary: An inside look at how OpenAI scaled PostgreSQL to millions of queries per second using replicas, caching, rate limiting, and workload isolation.

articles.title: Inside Praktika's conversational approach to language learning
articles.summary: How Praktika uses GPT-4.1 and GPT-5.2 to build adaptive AI tutors that personalize lessons, track progress, and help learners achieve real-world language fluency

articles.title: Inside GPT-5 for Work: How Businesses Use GPT-5
articles.summary: A data-driven report on how workers across industries use ChatGPT—covering adoption trends, top tasks, departmental patterns, and the future of AI at work.

articles.title: How Higgsfield turns simple ideas into cinematic social videos
articles.summary: Discover how Higgsfield gives creators cinematic, social-first video output from simple inputs using OpenAI GPT-4.1, GPT-5, and Sora 2.

articles.title: How countries can end the capability overhang
articles.summary: Our latest report reveals stark differences in advanced AI adoption across countries and outlines new initiatives to help nations capture productivity gains from AI.

articles.title: Introducing Edu for Countries
articles.summary: Edu for Countries is a new OpenAI initiative helping governments use AI to modernize education systems and build future-ready workforces.

articles.title: Horizon 1000: Advancing AI for primary healthcare
articles.summary: OpenAI and the Gates Foundation launch Horizon 1000, a $50M pilot advancing AI capabilities for healthcare in Africa. The initiative aims to reach 1,000 clinics by 2028.

articles.title: Stargate Community
articles.summary: Stargate Community plans detail a community-first approach to AI infrastructure, using locally tailored plans shaped by community input, energy needs, and workforce priorities.

articles.title: Cisco and OpenAI redefine enterprise engineering with AI agents
articles.summary: Cisco and OpenAI redefine enterprise engineering with Codex, an AI software agent embedded in workflows to speed builds, automate defect fixes, and enable AI-native development.

articles.title: ServiceNow powers actionable enterprise AI with OpenAI
articles.summary: ServiceNow expands access to OpenAI frontier models to power AI-driven enterprise workflows, summarization, search, and voice across the ServiceNow Platform.

articles.title: Our approach to age prediction
articles.summary: ChatGPT is rolling out age prediction to estimate if accounts are under or over 18, applying safeguards for teens and refining accuracy over time.

articles.title: AI for self empowerment
articles.summary: How AI can expand human agency by closing the capability overhang—helping people, businesses, and countries unlock real productivity, growth, and opportunity.

articles.title: A business that scales with the value of intelligence
articles.summary: OpenAI’s business model scales with intelligence—spanning subscriptions, API, ads, commerce, and compute—driven by deepening ChatGPT adoption.

articles.title: The truth left out from Elon Musk’s recent court filing
articles.summary: The truth left out from Elon Musk’s recent court filing.

articles.title: Introducing ChatGPT Go, now available worldwide
articles.summary: ChatGPT Go is now available worldwide, offering expanded access to GPT-5.2 Instant, higher usage limits, and longer memory—making advanced AI more affordable globally.

articles.title: Our approach to advertising and expanding access to ChatGPT
articles.summary: OpenAI plans to test advertising in the U.S. for ChatGPT’s free and Go tiers to expand affordable access to AI worldwide, while protecting privacy, trust, and answer quality.

articles.title: Investing in Merge Labs
articles.summary: OpenAI is investing in Merge Labs to support new brain computer interfaces that bridge biological and artificial intelligence to maximize human ability, agency, and experience.

articles.title: Strengthening the U.S. AI supply chain through domestic manufacturing
articles.summary: OpenAI launches a new RFP to strengthen the U.S. AI supply chain by accelerating domestic manufacturing, creating jobs, and scaling AI infrastructure.

articles.title: OpenAI partners with Cerebras
articles.summary: OpenAI partners with Cerebras to add 750MW of high-speed AI compute, reducing inference latency and making ChatGPT faster for real-time AI workloads.

articles.title: Zenken boosts a lean sales team with ChatGPT Enterprise
articles.summary: By rolling out ChatGPT Enterprise company-wide, Zenken has boosted sales performance, cut preparation time, and increased proposal success rates. AI-supported workflows are helping a lean team deliver more personalized, effective customer engagement.

articles.title: OpenAI’s Raising Concerns Policy
articles.summary: We’re publishing our Raising Concerns Policy, which protects employees’ rights to make protected disclosures.

articles.title: OpenAI and SoftBank Group partner with SB Energy
articles.summary: OpenAI and SoftBank Group partner with SB Energy to develop multi-gigawatt AI data center campuses, including a 1.2 GW Texas facility supporting the Stargate initiative.

articles.title: Datadog uses Codex for system-level code review
articles.summary: OpenAI and Datadog brand graphic with the OpenAI wordmark on the left, the Datadog logo on the right, and a central abstract brown fur-like texture panel on a white background.

articles.title: Netomi’s lessons for scaling agentic systems into the enterprise
articles.summary: How Netomi scales enterprise AI agents using GPT-4.1 and GPT-5.2—combining concurrency, governance, and multi-step reasoning for reliable production workflows.

articles.title: OpenAI for Healthcare
articles.summary: OpenAI for Healthcare enables secure, enterprise-grade AI that supports HIPAA compliance—reducing administrative burden and supporting clinical workflows.

articles.title: How Tolan builds voice-first AI with GPT-5.1
articles.summary: Tolan built a voice-first AI companion with GPT-5.1, combining low-latency responses, real-time context reconstruction, and memory-driven personalities for natural conversations.

articles.title: Introducing ChatGPT Health
articles.summary: ChatGPT Health is a dedicated experience that securely connects your health data and apps, with privacy protections and a physician-informed design.

articles.title: Announcing OpenAI Grove Cohort 2
articles.summary: Applications are now open for OpenAI Grove Cohort 2, a 5-week founder program designed for individuals at any stage, from pre-idea to product. Participants receive $50K in API credits, early access to AI tools, and hands-on mentorship from the OpenAI team.

articles.title: Continuously hardening ChatGPT Atlas against prompt injection
articles.summary: OpenAI is strengthening ChatGPT Atlas against prompt injection attacks using automated red teaming trained with reinforcement learning. This proactive discover-and-patch loop helps identify novel exploits early and harden the browser agent’s defenses as AI becomes more agentic.

articles.title: One in a million: celebrating the customers shaping AI’s future
articles.summary: More than one million customers around the world now use OpenAI to empower their teams and unlock new opportunities. This post highlights how companies like PayPal, Virgin Atlantic, BBVA, Cisco, Moderna, and Canva are transforming the way work gets done with AI.

articles.title: Evaluating chain-of-thought monitorability
articles.summary: OpenAI introduces a new framework and evaluation suite for chain-of-thought monitorability, covering 13 evaluations across 24 environments. Our findings show that monitoring a model’s internal reasoning is far more effective than monitoring outputs alone, offering a promising path toward scalable control as AI systems grow more capable.

articles.title: Deepening our collaboration with the U.S. Department of Energy
articles.summary: OpenAI and the U.S. Department of Energy have signed a memorandum of understanding to deepen collaboration on AI and advanced computing in support of scientific discovery. The agreement builds on ongoing work with national laboratories and helps establish a framework for applying AI to high-impact research across the DOE ecosystem.

articles.title: Updating our Model Spec with teen protections
articles.summary: OpenAI is updating its Model Spec with new Under-18 Principles that define how ChatGPT should support teens with safe, age-appropriate guidance grounded in developmental science. The update strengthens guardrails, clarifies expected model behavior in higher-risk situations, and builds on our broader work to improve teen safety across ChatGPT.

articles.title: AI literacy resources for teens and parents
articles.summary: OpenAI shares new AI literacy resources to help teens and parents use ChatGPT thoughtfully, safely, and with confidence. The guides include expert-vetted tips for responsible use, critical thinking, healthy boundaries, and supporting teens through emotional or sensitive topics.

articles.title: Introducing GPT-5.2-Codex
articles.summary: GPT-5.2-Codex is OpenAI’s most advanced coding model, offering long-horizon reasoning, large-scale code transformations, and enhanced cybersecurity capabilities.

articles.title: Introducing GPT-5.2-Codex
articles.summary: GPT-5.2-Codex is OpenAI’s most advanced coding model, offering long-horizon reasoning, large-scale code transformations, and enhanced cybersecurity capabilities.

articles.title: Addendum to GPT-5.2 System Card: GPT-5.2-Codex
articles.summary: This system card outlines the comprehensive safety measures implemented for GPT‑5.2-Codex. It details both model-level mitigations, such as specialized safety training for harmful tasks and prompt injections, and product-level mitigations like agent sandboxing and configurable network access.

articles.title: Introducing OpenAI Academy for News Organizations
articles.summary: OpenAI is launching the OpenAI Academy for News Organizations, a new learning hub built with the American Journalism Project and The Lenfest Institute to help newsrooms use AI effectively. The Academy offers training, practical use cases, and responsible-use guidance to support journalists, editors, and publishers as they adopt AI in their reporting and operations.

articles.title: Developers can now submit apps to ChatGPT
articles.summary: Developers can now submit apps for review and publication in ChatGPT, with approved apps appearing in a new in-product directory for easy discovery. Updated tools, guidelines, and the Apps SDK help developers build powerful chat-native experiences that bring real-world actions into ChatGPT.
